page.title: 04 A FARM IN ROADE
page.content: MR. MIDDLETON IS THE MANAGER OF BURMAN FARMS OF ROADE. HE LIVES AT "THE LAURELS" IN HARTWELL ROAD. IN 1985 HE IS PLANTING 140 HECTARS OF WHEAT, 45 HECTARS OF BARLEY AND 45 HECTARS OF RAPE.HE IS EXPECTING TO GET ABOUT 7.5 TONNES OF WHEAT,7 TONNES OF BARLEY OR 3.5 TONNES OF RAPE PER HECTARE. THE WHEAT WILL BE MADE INTO FLOUR FOR BAKING,THE BARLEY IS FOR FEEDING ANIMALS AND THE RAPE SEEDS ARE CRUSHED SO THAT THEIR OIL CAN BE MADE INTO MARGARINE OR COOKING OIL. THE FARM HAS A LANDROVER, A COMBINE HAVESTER, A FORK LIFT TRUCK AND FOUR TRACTORS. TWO OTHER FARM WORKERS HELP MR. MIDDLETON. THERE ARE ABOUT 40 STEERS ON THE FARM, KEPT FOR BEEF. THERE ARE NO DAIRY COWS. HE ALSO HAS A FEW BANTAMS AND COCKERELS. ( BY RICHARD SHELFORD. AGE 10 )
